Песок

Мнемоника

Песок образуется вследствие измельчения 少 камней 石.

shā
sand; gravel; granule; variant of 沙
песок; гравий; гранула; вариант 沙
rtega_mnemonic:
砂砂RSsand, pebbles, gravel, gritty
  • small 少 stones 石
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: Many small 少 stones 石; 少 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
砂岩 [ shā yán ]: sandstone
朱砂 [ zhū shā ]: cinnabar; mercuric sulfide HgS; also written 朱砂
朱砂 [ zhū shā ]: cinnabar; mercuric sulfide HgS
砂锅 [ shā guō ]: casserole; earthenware pot
砂轮 [ shā lún ]: grinding wheel; emery wheel
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 石 [ shí ] stone, rock, mineral
    • 少 [ shǎo ] few, little; less; inadequate
heisig_chinese_memo: When stones get old they become few and turn to gravel.
heisig_story: Good sand for beaches has few or no stones in it. That means that all of us whose feet have been spoiled by too much time in shoes don't have to watch our step as we cavort about.
koohiiStory1: Here´s how I remember that stone is on the left. This is because sand starts as stones, and only later they become few.
koohiiStory2: In good SAND, stones are few, if any.
jp_example_words:
砂利(じゃり): gravel, ballast, pebbles
砂漠(さばく): desert
砂(すな): sand
砂糖(さとう): sugar
jp_readingExamples: 砂丘 (さきゅう), 砂糖 (さとう), 砂 (すな)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you grind a stone down to more than just a few pieces, it will become sand. Stones that get broken up enough will become sand, and you pick up a few grains in your hand.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Feel these few grains of sand between your fingertips. Imagine the stones that they originally came from. Nature is crazy.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: What’s in your hand? A few grains of sand (さ)! Sand, sand, sand!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Just remember that stones become sand and if you remember that this kanji means sand you’ll remember how to pronounce it as well.
Ru_Radicals: ノ, 口 (рот), 小 (маленький), 石 (камень)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: few (少) stones (石) become sand
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When stones get old they become few and turn to gravel.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " stone ", " sand " to save sound. " Sand " is the same as " sand ", which means finely divided stones. "Jade articles. Shibu": "Sand, vulgar words for sand." Such as "Han Shu. "Gao Di Ji": "The strong wind starts from the northwest, the wood is made of the house, the gravel is raised, the day is dark, the Chu army is in chaos, and the Han king has to flee with dozens of horses." Li Qi of the Tang Dynasty "Congjun Xing": "Pedestrians Diao Dou has a dark wind, and Princess Pipa has a lot of grudges."

" Sand " is extended to mean a material as finely as " sand ". Such as "Heavenly Creations. Sweet addiction. "Cane Seed": "There are two kinds of sugarcane...the smaller one is sugar cane. The mouth is thorny and it hurts the lips and tongue. People dare not eat it. Hoarfrost and red sand will come out from here." Another example is "sugar" and " "Sandpaper", "Mineral Sand", etc.

" Sand " especially refers to cinnabar. "Cinnabar" is a mineral, also known as "Cinnabar", "Cinnabar", and "Cinnabar". It can be used as medicine or as a pigment. "Compendium of Materia Medica. Stone Department. "Dansha": "Dansha is born in the flaming prescription, and it is formed from the qi from the fire. The body is yang and the sex is yin. Therefore, the red color is external and contains real mercury. Its qi is not hot but cold, and there is yin away from the middle. Its flavor Not bitter but sweet, there is soil in the fire." "Cinnabar" was the main raw material for alchemy alchemists in ancient times. For example, in the Northern Song Dynasty Su Shi's "Distinguish the Taoist Songs": "Yi Dan breaks away the sand inside and outside, and cultivates owed bait and must rise." "Journey to the West" Chapter 44: "He will knead sand to refine mercury, meditate to preserve God, and use water as oil. , Turning stones into gold."
humanum_short_description_en: From " stone " to " sand " to save the sound. " Sand " is the same as " sand ", which means finely divided stones.
humanum_full_description:
從「石」，「沙」省聲。「砂」同「沙」，表示細碎的石粒。《玉篇．石部》：「砂，俗沙字。」如《漢書．高帝紀》：「大風從西北起，折木發屋，揚砂石，晝晦，楚軍大亂，而漢王得與數十騎遁去。」唐代李頎〈從軍行〉：「行人刁鬥風砂暗，公主琵琶幽怨多。」

　　「砂」引申表示像「砂」一樣細碎的物質。如《天工開物．甘嗜．蔗種》：「凡甘蔗有二種……似荻而小者為糖蔗，口啖即棘傷唇舌，人不敢食，白霜、紅砂皆從此出。」又如「砂糖」、「砂紙」、「礦砂」等。

　　「砂」特指朱砂。「朱砂」是一種礦物，又稱「丹砂」、「硃砂」、「辰砂」，可入藥，亦可作顏料。《本草綱目．石部．丹砂》：「丹砂生于炎方，禀離火之氣而成，體陽而性陰，故外顯丹色而內含真汞。其氣不熱而寒，離中有陰也。其味不苦而甘，火中有土也。」「朱砂」是古代方士煉丹的主要原料。如北宋蘇軾〈辨道歌〉：「一丹休別內外砂，長修欠餌須升遐。」《西遊記》第44回：「他會摶砂煉汞，打坐存神，指水為油，點石成金。」
humanum_short_description: 從「石」，「沙」省聲。「砂」同「沙」，表示細碎的石粒。

從「 石 」，「 沙 」省聲。「 砂 」同「 沙 」，表示細碎的石粒。《玉篇．石部》：「砂，俗沙字。」如《漢書．高帝紀》：「大風從西北起，折木發屋，揚砂石，晝晦，楚軍大亂，而漢王得與數十騎遁去。」唐代李頎〈從軍行〉：「行人刁鬥風砂暗，公主琵琶幽怨多。」 「 砂 」引申表示像「 砂 」一樣細碎的物質。如《天工開物．甘嗜．蔗種》：「凡甘蔗有二種……似荻而小者為糖蔗，口啖即棘傷唇舌，人不敢食，白霜、紅砂皆從此出。」又如「砂糖」、「砂紙」、「礦砂」等。 「 砂 」特指朱砂。「朱砂」是一種礦物，又稱「丹砂」、「硃砂」、「辰砂」，可入藥，亦可作顏料。《本草綱目．石部．丹砂》：「丹砂生于炎方，禀離火之氣而成，體陽而性陰，故外顯丹色而內含真汞。其氣不熱而寒，離中有陰也。其味不苦而甘，火中有土也。」「朱砂」是古代方士煉丹的主要原料。如北宋蘇軾〈辨道歌〉：「一丹休別內外砂，長修欠餌須升遐。」《西遊記》第44回：「他會摶砂煉汞，打坐存神，指水為油，點石成金。」

shā
1) (крупный) песок; гравий
2) киноварь
砂汞 киноварь и ртуть
Radicals: 石, 少  (stone, few)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you grind a stone down to more than just a few pieces, it will become sand. Stones that get broken up enough will become sand, and you pick up a few grains in your hand.
Feel these few grains of sand between your fingertips. Imagine the stones that they originally came from. Nature is crazy.
Reading Mnemonic
What’s in your hand? A few grains of sand (さ)! Sand, sand, sand!
Just remember that stones become sand and if you remember that this kanji means sand you’ll remember how to pronounce it as well.
